title: Cappadocian Fathers: Basil, Gregory & Athanasius
description: The great 4th century Greek Church Fathers who defined Nicene orthodoxy and established Christian theological vocabulary: Athanasius's defense of the Trinity, Basil's monastic rule, and the two Gregories' theological and rhetorical brilliance.

keyFigures: Athanasius of Alexandria (c.296-373): Defender of Nicene orthodoxy against Arianism
Basil the Great (c.330-379): Cappadocian Father, monastic legislator, theologian
Gregory of Nazianzus (329-390): 'The Theologian' - rhetorical brilliance, Trinitarian theology
Gregory of Nyssa (c.335-395): Philosophical theologian, mystical theology
John Chrysostom (c.347-407): 'Golden Mouth' - greatest Greek preacher
researchValue: Foundational for understanding the development of Christian theology, Trinitarian doctrine, and Greek patristic thought. Basil's monastic rule shaped Eastern monasticism. Gregory of Nyssa influenced mystical theology.
